intro: Spermaulaxen dichotomus, commonly known as the forked liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, flat, and often branched thallus that grows close to the ground in moist, shaded environments. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a simple structure composed of a single layer of cells. It reproduces through spores, which are produced in small, cup-like structures called sporophytes. Spermaulaxen dichotomus is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in humid and cool climates.
